meanings.definition: To arrange or designate as a zone.
meanings.sent1: The event coordinator zooned the venue for different activities.
meanings.sent2: She zooned the garden into sections for flowers and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The chef zooned the kitchen into prep and cooking zones for efficiency.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts zooned around the upcoming presentation, mentally preparing each zone of content.
meanings.sent5: The architect zooned the building into functional areas, optimizing space usage.

meanings.definition: To surround or enclose with a zone.
meanings.sent1: The fence zooned the playground for safety.
meanings.sent2: They zooned the construction site to keep unauthorized personnel out.
meanings.sent3: The security guard zooned the area with caution tape after the accident.
meanings.sent4: The mist zooned the mountain peak, creating an ethereal zone of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the fireplace zooned the living room into a cozy retreat from the cold outside.
